key_facts: LinkedIn is a professional networking platform connecting individuals, companies, and recruiters globally.
LinkedIn offers job search and career development opportunities for professionals.
Companies use LinkedIn for employer branding and recruiting qualified candidates.
Advertisers can target users based on professional roles, industries, and interests.
LinkedIn's primary channels are its website and mobile app.
Key resources include the technology platform, user data, and brand reputation.
LinkedIn partners with content creators known as 'Top Voices' to promote content.
LinkedIn collaborates with educational institutions offering certification programs.
Premium subscriptions provide features like InMail credits and advanced job search tools.
Advertising revenue comes from companies paying to reach LinkedIn's professional audience.
Platform development, marketing, sales, and customer support are major cost areas.
LinkedIn serves three main customer segments: professionals, companies/recruiters, and advertisers.
Most users access LinkedIn through self-service functionality.
Enterprise customers receive direct support alongside self-service options.
The full business model canvas is available for download on the business model website.
